title: Things to remember when meeting your SO's parents
text: Diwali is here, and it's time for shopping and gorging down on all those sweets! It's also the time to join in with friends and family for joyous celebrations. If this Diwali, you're planning to meet your SO’s parents and score some brownie points, here's a simple list to help you navigate the situation. Just so that you stay in the brownie zone, and charm them with your stories, we have come up with some things to remember while meeting your SO’s parents.Whether it is your first time or your hundredth time, always take along something for your SO’s parents. It could be something your partner may have spoken of in the passing or something more of emotional value. Or you can simply take sweets or chocolates. That always scores points!It could be something as simple as a sinfully delicious appetizer or something to accompany the mains or the mains itself. Telling your partner’s parents that you are willing to give a helping hand portrays you as part of the family and helps smooth things when you show up.The best way to score with parents, in general, is to always listen to what they have to say. It could be about a TV daily soap, socio-political conditions or simply about how they've decorated their home for Diwali. Always be engaged in the conversation and perhaps make a list of topics that could start conversations.You simply love his parents and are getting comfortable with them. They are telling you your partner’s embarrassing childhood stories and you want to join in on the fun. However, you still want to keep some things to yourself as oversharing can lead to some awkward silences.Your partner is so lucky to have you, their rockstar and their pillar of support, right beside him to help him have a fabulous time. Kind and encouraging words can help both of you to enjoy family time and stay clear of controversial topics.While it is difficult to not be on the phone, especially when your WhatsApp is buzzing, it is best if you look at your phone only when you want to use it for calls or click pictures for family. Being on phone all the time may make you appear as disinterested in family and we all know that the fabulous you is anything but that.Diwali is one time when you can make the most of being with your partner and his family. So relax, and enjoy being around family, surrounded with warmth and love.
description: This Diwali, get your charms and your smiles out and impress your partner’s folks with these simple things. Meeting SOs parents is now a cake walk.
